root-03oqmq3.label: Project
root-03oqmq3.content: A project refers to the specific product, system, or feature that the technical writer is responsible for documenting.

hub-mdmcvb1.label: Technical Writer
hub-mdmcvb1.content: The technical writer will act as bridge between the people who build a product and the people who use it.

child-cmnhgfy.label: DDLC process
child-cmnhgfy.content: DDLC is a structured process that technical writers use to plan, create, publish, and maintain high-quality documentation.

child-fousak3.label: 1. Requirement
child-fousak3.content:
Requirement Gathering & Planning

Key Activities:

• Audience Analysis
• Scope Definition
• Tool Selection
• Timeline & Resource Planning

child-62wenmo.label: 2. Design
child-62wenmo.content:
This is the core "writing" phase where the actual content is created based on the plan.

Key Activities:

• Information Gathering
• Drafting
• Creating Visuals
• Structuring Content

child-ev85zoz.label: 3. Review & Editing
child-ev85zoz.content:
A critical quality assurance phase to ensure the documentation is accurate, clear, and consistent.

Key Activities:

• Self Review
• Peer Review
• Editing & Proofreading
• Revision

child-v3g4kve.label: 4. Publishing & Deployment:
child-v3g4kve.content:
This is the stage where the final, approved documentation is made available to the intended audience.

Key Activities:

•  Formatting & Finalizing
•  Deployment
•  Announcing

child-mvw8gao.label: Audience Analysis
child-mvw8gao.content: Who are we writing for? (e.g., expert developers, non-technical end-users, internal support teams).

child-r0pr6fc.label: Scope Definition
child-r0pr6fc.content: What features or topics need to be documented? What is out of scope?

child-zltlsty.label: Tool Selection
child-zltlsty.content: What platform will we use? (This is where you decided on Docusaurus /  word).

child-x9x879n.label: Timeline & Resource Planning:
child-x9x879n.content: Setting deadlines and identifying subject matter experts (SMEs).

child-abogd3c.label: Information Gathering
child-abogd3c.content: Interviewing developers / engineers, product managers, and other SMEs.

child-hcg3bbe.label: Drafting
child-hcg3bbe.content: Writing the initial version of the content.

child-3m6e2bc.label: Creating Visuals
child-3m6e2bc.content: Designing diagrams, screenshots, and other visuals to support the text.

child-dqu0pr2.label: Structuring Content
child-dqu0pr2.content: Organizing the information logically (using sidebars.js in or arrangement of ToC).

child-kb1nbk9.label: Editing & Proofreading
child-kb1nbk9.content: Checking for grammar, spelling, and adherence to the style guide.

child-fx8dnk0.label: Self review
child-fx8dnk0.content: Perform the self checking for clarity, style, and consistency.

child-t0j5nq5.label: Peer review
child-t0j5nq5.content: SMEs (engineers, product managers, technical writer's) review the draft for technical accuracy.

child-4essg3m.label: Revision
child-4essg3m.content: Incorporating all the feedback into the draft.

child-uunu3eg.label: Deployment
child-uunu3eg.content: Pushing the content to a live server (like using GitHub Pages with Docusaurus).

child-g03t938.label: Updating Content
child-g03t938.content: Revising the documentation to reflect product updates, new features, or bug fixes.

child-m922daq.label: Announcing
child-m922daq.content: Notifying the audience that new or updated documentation is available.

child-newfik2.label: 5. Maintenance
child-newfik2.content:
Documentation is a living thing. This ongoing phase ensures that the content remains accurate and relevant over time.

Key Activities:

•  User Feedback
•  Updating Content
•  Archiving

child-bvn2n6l.label: User Feedback
child-bvn2n6l.content: Monitoring feedback channels (like comments or analytics) to identify areas for improvement.

child-uqu0isl.label: Updating Content
child-uqu0isl.content: Revising the documentation to reflect product updates, new features, or bug fixes.

child-45l3rpc.label: Archiving
child-45l3rpc.content: Retiring outdated documentation for old product versions to avoid confusion.

backlinks.note: The focus now shifts to creating the actual documentation.
It enters a critical review phase to ensure accuracy and clarity.
Now the doc ready to be published for the audience.
After the documentation goes live, the lifecycle continues with ongoing updates to keep the content current.
As the product evolves, user feedback and new features are gathered to inform the plan for the next documentation update.
